Events that occurred on 14 January.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1936 - In his Preface to Roman Britain and the English Settlements, R.G. Collingwood on this date writes about J.R.R. Tolkien's contribution to the book.
1938 â€“ J.R.R. Tolkien gives a talk about Anglo-Saxon Verse on BBC Radio.
1956 - Tolkien writes Letter 180.
1956 - Tolkien writes a a letter to Peter Alford.
1973 - Reader N.J. Kyle writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.
2005 - The first "The One Ring Celebration" starts.
2008 - The Lord of the Rings: The Ultimate Critical Review is released.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3019:
The Fellowship of the Ring travel through Moria from mid-morning to evening. They spend the night in Hall Twenty-one.
